explanations.A: Answer A describes the process for drawing an equilateral triangle, and then bisecting the angle created. It may be helpful to remember 'bisect' means 'to cut in half'. What size angle do we end up with here? Think what set of lines / shape would contain a 60° angle when constructed.
explanations.B: Answer B describes the process for constructing a perpendicular line and then bisecting this angle. What angle do perpendicular lines meet at? It may also be helpful to remember bisect means 'cut in half' Think what set of lines / shape would contain a 60° angle when constructed.
explanations.C: Equilateral triangles have interior angles of 60°, and answer C describes the process for drawing an equilateral triangle. Therefore by drawing an equilateral triangle, you would have constructed a 60° angle.
explanations.D: Answer D describes the process for constructing a perpendicular line. What angle do perpendicular lines meet at? Think what set of lines / shape would contain a 60° angle when constructed.
